oai:clarin-pl.eu:11321/34;2016-01-21T14:35:40Z;hdl_11321_3;hdl_11321_4;WCCL;Radziszewski, Adam;Wardyński, Adam;Śniatowski, Tomasz;WCCL (Wrocław Corpus Constraint Language) is a formalism for writing functional expressions evaluated on morpho-syntactically annotated text. These expressions may be used directly as features for Machine Learning classification.

Implementation-wise, WCCL is a set of simple command-line utils, as well as the underlying C++ library with Python wrappers, suitable for rapid development of taggers, chunkers, etc.

WCCL is targeted at Polish, although the only obstacle to processing other inflectional languages is probably the assumed string representation of tags and corpus I/O formats.;2011-06-14;toolService;http://hdl.handle.net/11321/34;pol;downloadable_files_count: 0;Wrocław University of Technology;http://nlp.pwr.wroc.pl/redmine/projects/joskipi/wiki/Install
name: 1bfb53f1-022b-5b2e-8929-45c66e4d3a83
notes:
WCCL (Wrocław Corpus Constraint Language) is a formalism for writing functional expressions evaluated on morpho-syntactically annotated text. These expressions may be used directly as features for Machine Learning classification.

Implementation-wise, WCCL is a set of simple command-line utils, as well as the underlying C++ library with Python wrappers, suitable for rapid development of taggers, chunkers, etc.

WCCL is targeted at Polish, although the only obstacle to processing other inflectional languages is probably the assumed string representation of tags and corpus I/O formats.
title: WCCL
